documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
said again and again “This is mybody!” and they have reason to feel
angry, reason to feel that it has been like shouting into the wind. Smith, after
all, is hardly likely to bless us if we say to him, “Of course it’s your coat; any-
body would grant that it is. But no one may choose between you and Jones
who is to have it.”
